protected_spaces_details.description: Outdoor sports facilities incl school playing fields

description:
DEMOLITION OF EXISTING BUILDINGS AND DEVELOPMENT OF NORTHERN PART OF SITE (LAND BETWEEN THE REAR OF 5 TO 15 FAIRWAY AND BUSHEY ROAD) FOR 50 RESIDENTIAL UNITS COMPRISING FLATS AND HOUSES.

APPLICATION FOR APPROVAL OF RESERVED MATTERS (LAYOUT, SCALE, APPEARANCE AND LANDSCAPING) FOLLOWING THE GRANT OF OUTLINE PLANNING PERMISSION REF  05/P2802.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - REASON FOR APPROVAL.
The application seeks approval of Reserved Matters for development of part of the playing fields site by the erection of two buildings comprising 40 flats and 10 town houses, together with associated access and landscaping. The design, layout, appearance and landscaping of the proposal is considered to be acceptable. The proposal accords with the Council's Adopted Development Plan and London Plan Policies. The policies listed below were relevant to the determination of this proposal.
Adopted Merton Unitary Development Plan (October 2003):-
HP.1 (Housing Target)
HS.1 (Housing Layout and Amenity)
NE.1 (Metropolitan Open Land)
NE.8 (Green Corridors)
NE.11 (Trees-Protection)
NE.12 (Trees, Hedges and Landscape Features)
BE.15 (New Buildings nd Extensions; Daylight, Sunlight, Privacy, Visual Intrusion and Noise)
BE.16 (Urban Design)
BE.22 (Design of New Development)
PK.2 and PK.3 (Parking)
LU.5 (Developer Conreibutions)

The London Plan (February 2008)
3A.1 (Increasing London's Supply of Housing)
3A.2 (Borough Housing Targets)
Condition : 2 - INFORMATIVE: Your attention is drawn to the conditions attached to the Planning Inspector's decision letter dated 4th April 2007
